meanings.definition: The act of carrying or transporting something byrling
meanings.sent1: The byrling of the heavy boxes was tiring.
meanings.sent2: She excelled in the art of byrling groceries.
meanings.sent3: The byrling of the balloons made the clown float away!
meanings.sent4: His determination was a byrling force in achieving his goals.
meanings.sent5: The byrling of the books onto the shelf was a satisfying task.

meanings.definition: A person who is skilled in the art of byrling
meanings.sent1: The experienced byrling knew how to handle fragile items.
meanings.sent2: The byrling helped move furniture with ease.
meanings.sent3: The byrling's expertise saved the day during the move.
meanings.sent4: She was a true byrling, always ready to lend a hand.
meanings.sent5: The byrling's precision was admired by all.

meanings.definition: The process of securing or fastening something byrling
meanings.sent1: The byrling of the rope was essential for safety.
meanings.sent2: He demonstrated the proper byrling of the knots.
meanings.sent3: The byrling of the lock kept the treasure safe.
meanings.sent4: Her byrling of the belt was quick and efficient.
meanings.sent5: The byrling of the straps ensured everything stayed in place.
